Israel's reign of terror over the West Bank
subhed: Deadly shootings by the army, beatings by settlers, devastating raids, arbitrary arrests, torture in prison: The level of violence inflicted on Palestinians living in the territory has never been so high since the Israeli occupation began in 1967.

title: To yield or not to yield the Donbas to Russia is at the heart of Zelensky's dilemma

US lawmakers rebuke Trump's foreign policy with a sweeping defense bill to strengthen European security
subhed: The vote came shortly after the White House published a national security strategy that was a startling attack on Europe. The House's $900 billion Pentagon bill reveals a clear pro-Europe orientation.

title: Trump exchanges 'pretty strong words' with European leaders over Ukraine
subhed: Rifts over Ukraine continued to grow after the US president's phone call with leaders of France, Germany, and Britain. The exchange comes after Trump described Europe as 'decaying' and 'weak' on immigration.

title: Sophie Kinsella, British 'Shopaholic' author, dies aged 55
subhed: Madeleine Sophie Wickham, who wrote under the pen name Sophie Kinsella, revealed last year that she was receiving chemotherapy and radiotherapy for glioblastoma, an aggressive form of brain cancer.

title: 'By appeasing Russia and accommodating China, the Trump administration is carving up the world into spheres of influence'
subhed: Since the release of the US National Security Strategy on December 5, the increasingly harsh tone of the transatlantic relationship has drawn attention, even though this power struggle was not among Donald Trump's main priorities, writes Le Monde columnist Gilles Paris.

title: The ultra-rich are claiming an increasing share of global wealth
subhed: The wealth of the ultra-rich is undergoing a historic surge, according to the third report of the World Inequality Lab co-directed by French economist Thomas Piketty. Political choices can reverse these trends, the authors say.

title: Illegal crosses in French public spaces reignite debates over church-state separation
subhed: Calvaries installed on public land in towns in the Alps, on the Mediterranean coast and on the island of Corsica, sometimes with the help of far-right identitarian movements, have rekindled long-standing tensions around France's 1905 law separating churches and state.

title: Japan sees disinformation spread as right-wing influence grows
subhed: Japan's political and social crises have fueled a climate of anxiety and a surge in right-wing radicalization, notably among young people. The right has taken advantage of this to whitewash the facts of the war (1931-1945).
